Dear {{book.owner.profile.salutation_name}},

You have been recommended as a potential peer reviewer for a book submitted to {{press_name}}. The book has been provisionally titled {{book.title}}.

The contents to review has been summarised as below:

{{book.description}}

As part of the editorial process with all {{press_name}} publications, books are reviewed according to the following general principles:

  • that conclusions are presented in an appropriate fashion and are supported by the data
  • that the manuscript is presented in an intelligible fashion
  • that the Foreword and Epilogue tie in with the book contents well

We aim to publish books that are solid works of scholarship, irrespective of potential 'impact'. The text is available now for review / will be available from [add start date] [DELETE AS APPROPRIATE]. If you would like to accept or decline this invitation simply click the link below and select the appropriate option. If accepting the invitation you will then have full access to the review files and peer review details.

{{revision_url}}

We are aiming to have the review completed by {{revision.due}}, therefore please consider whether this would be possible if accepting the invitation. If you require a different schedule then please let me know.

Thank you for considering this request. As always, the efforts of all peer reviewers are greatly appreciated. If you are unable to undertake this review, we would greatly appreciate any thoughts you might have on others who we might approach.

Many thanks for your time and consideration of this invitation,

Kind regards,

{{sender.first_name}}{% if sender %}{{ sender.profile.signature|safe }}{% endif %}

Dear {{review.user.profile.salutation_name}},

You have been recommended as a potential reviewer for a book proposal submitted to {{press_name}}. The proposal has been provisionally titled {{book.title}}.

All books proposed to {{press_name}} are reviewed prior to full submission. We are therefore looking for an expert in this field to comment on the content of the proposal and would very much appreciated it if you would consider this invitation to complete the review. In general, we are looking for a brief comment on the following principals: 1) are there any significant weaknesses/errors included in the book details?, 2) is there a need for such a book/would researchers find this useful?, and 3) are there suggestions on how the book content could be improved? We aim to publish books that are solid works of scholarship, irrespective of potential impact.

The proposal details are available now for review. Please accept or decline this invitation by clicking the link below and select the appropriate option. If accepting the invitation you will then have full access to the proposal details.

{{review_url}}

We are aiming to have the proposal review completed by {{review.due}}, therefore please consider whether this would be possible if accepting the invitation. If you require a different schedule then please let me know.

Thank you for considering this request. As always, the efforts of all reviewers are greatly appreciated.

If you are unable to undertake this review, we would greatly appreciate any thoughts you might have on others who we might approach.

Many thanks for your time and consideration of this invitation,

Kind regards,

Dear{{ submission.owner.profile.salutation_name }},

Your book submission {{book.title}} has now completed our copyediting stage and is available for your final review and sign off prior to typesetting. You should be able to log into the editorial system using the below details to access the file, which will show edits via 'tracked changes' and also any questions that the copyeditor may have directed to you.

Please can you now review this file and accept all changes or detail your additional edits. When you are happy with the content then please upload the files to the editorial system. Please note that this is the last opportunity to make changes to the content of the book. The proofreading stage that follows the preparation of the galley proofs is restricted to correcting typographical and layout errors only, and not a further round of editorial changes.

If you are unable to undertake this work or have any questions, please contact me. The files and deadline for re-submission should all be available to you when you log into the account.

Kind regards,

{{sender.first_name}} {% if sender %}{{ sender.profile.signature|safe }}{% endif %}

fields.value:
Competing Interests

We are committed to transparent and bias-free research. To ensure that all publications are as open as possible all authors, reviewers and editors are required to declare any interests that could appear to compromise, conflict or influence the validity of the publication. This process is designed to reinforce the readers' trust in the research data.

Please declare any competing interests that you have. A conflict of interest must be declared if there is any reason why the information or the interpretation of information being produced may be influenced by a personal or financial relationship with other organisations or individuals, or if these relationships could be reasonably perceived from other people as having influencing objective data or decision-making. Everyone involved in the submission, editorial processing, peer review and publication should declare any competing interests that they may have as early as possible.

Competing interests can take the form of both financial and non-financial relationships. The declaration of such relationships helps to ensure that academic rigour is maintained and that publications cannot be accused of undue bias or misinformation.

Examples of competing interests:

  • receipt of payment, in any form, from an organisation or individual related to the subject matter
  • ownership of stocks or shares in organisations directly related to the subject matter
  • receipt of grants or funding
  • membership of relevant boards
  • related patents/applied for patents
  • gifts
  • known relationships that will hinder impartiality (e.g. colleagues, family, mentor, previous supervisor/student).
  • political, religious, ideological interests
  • commercial

Competing interests should generally be declared to cover at least the previous 5 years - e.g., if a reviewer supervised the author's PhD then (and if they feel comfortable reviewing the work) their professional relationship should have ended over 5 years ago. This is a minimum requirement, and individuals must declare if they have had a previous relationship with someone/an organisation relevant to the submission that could be deemed to influence decision making.

For authors

Please add a competing interests statement into the appropriate section during the submission process. The authors’ initials should be used to denote differing competing interests. For example:

“TW completed paid consultancy work from [company name] as part of the data acquisition for this study. BH has minority shares in [company name], which part funded the research grant for this project. SM is a member of the editorial board for [journal name], which is on a voluntary basis. All other authors have no competing interests."

If there are no competing interests, please add the below statement:

“The authors declare that they have no competing interests.”

For reviewers

If you have any competing interests, please list them in the text box available on your reviewer page. For example:

"I was previously employed by the laboratory that collected this data."

 If you do not have competing interests, please add the below statement:

"I have no competing interests to declare."
